searchDocs.content: </> VisualHandler:UpdateValue( Team: Theteamyouwanttochangethevalueof, ValueType: Thetypeofvalueyouwanttochange, NewValue: Thenewvalue ) → () This function just sets the new value of a certain value of the team you specify.

searchDocs.title: ConvertToDisplayableFormat​
searchDocs.content: </> TimerCalculator.ConvertToDisplayableFormat( Time: number-- The time increment you want to pass ) → string-- The converted format Just adds a 0 in front of the number if needed for the scoreboard text

searchDocs.title: CalculateTime​
searchDocs.content: </> TimerCalculator:CalculateTime() → string-- The current in-game time Calculates the time and returns it as a text format straight for your timer text

searchDocs.title: Errors
searchDocs.content: Type	Description"Potential overflow"	You shouldn't call this when the timer playing value is false otherwise the timer will continue to run

searchDocs.title: SetTimerTime​
searchDocs.content: </> TimerModule:SetTimerTime( Minutes: number,-- The minute you want to set the timer to Seconds: number-- The second you want to set the timer to ) → () This function sets the new time of the scoreboard. We usually use this for fixing the client time if the timer stops for a while and then restarts You might want to note that this automatically adjusts for overflows (e.g trying to set the time to 3:80 will adjust it to 4:20)

searchDocs.title: StartTimer​
searchDocs.content: </> TimerModule:StartTimer() → () This starts the timer for the client to track NOTE: This doesn't account for extra time, you'll have to add that yourself
